solution_line_template: During dinner time, Yves and his siblings ate {total_slices}/{dinner_eaten_denominator} = <<{total_slices}/{dinner_eaten_denominator}={dinner_eaten_slices}>>{dinner_eaten_slices} slices.
So the next day, there were still {total_slices} - {dinner_eaten_slices} = <<{total_slices}-{dinner_eaten_slices}={slices_left_after_dinner}>>{slices_left_after_dinner} slices left.
The next day, Yves ate {slices_left_after_dinner}/{yves_eaten_denominator} = <<{slices_left_after_dinner}/{yves_eaten_denominator}={yves_eaten_slices}>>{yves_eaten_slices} slices of pizza.
Then, his {num_siblings} siblings ate {slices_per_sibling} x {num_siblings} = <<{slices_per_sibling}*{num_siblings}={siblings_eaten_slices}>>{siblings_eaten_slices} slices of pizza.
Therefore, there were still {slices_left_after_yves} - {siblings_eaten_slices} = <<{slices_left_after_yves}-{siblings_eaten_slices}={final_slices_left}>>{final_slices_left} slices of pizza left.
